alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:26AM EDT until April 18 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.9 feet, Water reaches the bottom girder of the M-35 bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EDT WEDNESDAY the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 7.5 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.9 feet on 04/17/2002. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 230 AM EDT.
